page.title: 1174 Years of Fritchley
page.content:
{How many deliveries were made in the {village? A coal wagon came once a month. The deliveries of groceries were made in a pony and trap. Everything else they had to fetch by walking or biking to Ripley. Later on, an open decked bus ran to Ripley. {What was it like at School? It was very strict and you had to pay one penny on Monday to buy books for the school. We did dictation and arithmetic and composition. We had to learn tables for homework, and if you didn't do it you had to go to the front of the classroom and face the wall.
